unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Logistics Delays Plague Indian Manufacturers**
normalised: manufacturing and supply chain: logistics delays plague indian manufacturers

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26 - Persistent logistics delays are significantly impacting Indian manufacturers, causing ripples throughout the supply chain, reminiscent of the logistical nightmares portrayed in the Bollywood film, "Bhagam Bhag". A recent study by IIM Ahmedabad reveals that average lead times for raw materials have increased by 15% in the last quarter.
normalised: new delhi, october twenty six - persistent logistics delays are significantly impacting indian manufacturers, causing ripples throughout the supply chain, reminiscent of the logistical nightmares portrayed in the bollywood film, "bhagam bhag". a recent study by I I M ahmedabad reveals that average lead times for raw materials have increased by fifteen percent in the last quarter.

unnormalised: The delays, attributed to a combination of factors including port congestion at Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (JNPT) and inadequate road infrastructure, are particularly affecting industries reliant on imported components, such as electronics and pharmaceuticals. Many small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in Ludhiana and Surat are struggling to meet export deadlines, facing potential penalties.

unnormalised: "The delays are costing us dearly. We're paying demurrage charges and losing valuable contracts," says Mr. Sharma, owner of a textile manufacturing unit in Jaipur. The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has urged the government to expedite infrastructure projects and streamline customs procedures to alleviate the pressure on the manufacturing sector. The estimated cost of these delays runs into Rs. 500 crore annually. The government is aiming to increase road construction by 20 km per day to ease congestion.
